content.body: Found an interoperability issue with flexbox vs img elements, I think. However, I can't tell whether the (accidentally useful?) behaviour in Firefox is correct, or whether what Safari/Chrome do is correct. Reduced test case at https://codepen.io/Krinkle/full/wvJrxQO
In Firefox, the images shrink as needed to fit within the row.
in Safari/Chrome, the image's box model becomes wider than natural and pushes out the third and fourth image
I can workaround it by changing `width: 100%` to `width: calc(100% / 4)`, but seems like that shouldn't be needed.
